page.title: Basic, Single-Clause Sentences - Intransitive and Copular Sentences
page.introduction: Simple intransitives do not have any complements after the verb, such as The girl swims. Motion verbs include a location in the form of either a PP or adverb. English examples of motion verbs include:

EnglishExample.exItem: The girl ran around the track.
My mother went to the store.

form.prompt: Key your examples with motion verbs here:
form.instruction: Partial subcategorization can be done as follows, without entering a feature on every verb: if a particular verb is intransitive and can never have anything but a subject, mark it with the feature intransitive. (Don't consider temporal elements.) If it is an intransitive motion verb that can have a locative PP or AdvP following preceding it, add the feature motion to its lexical entry. Since the motion verbs are a small, closed set, the feature must be entered in the lexicon on the appropriate verbs; the default setting is -motion.
form.introduction: Copular sentences can have an adjective, PP, or nominal phrase following the copular verb. Some languages do not require a copular verb or auxiliary to be present. English examples include:

radioGroup.prompt: Does your language have an overt verb used in copular type sentences?
radioGroup.radio: Yes, and the copular verb is required
Yes, the language has a copular verb, but it is optional in at least some cases and no auxiliary is required then
Yes, the language has a copular verb, but it is optional when an auxiliary is present
No, there is no copular verb but an auxiliary is required
No, neither a verb nor an auxiliary is used in copular type sentences

radioGroup.prompt: Is there an affix which occurs on the predicate nominal or predicate adjective in copular sentences when there is no copular verb present?
radioGroup.radio: Yes, sometimes it is a prefix and sometimes a suffix is used

form.instruction: Add either of the features copular_prefix or copular_suffix to the appropriate affixes in the lexicon.
Add the feature copular_prefix to the appropriate prefix(es) in the lexicon.
Add the feature copular_suffix to the appropriate suffix(es) in the lexicon.

Add the feature copular to the verbs that take AdjP, PP or predicate nominative complements. Since the copular verbs are a small, closed set, the feature must be entered in the lexicon on the appropriate verbs; the default setting is -copular.
